overview: The wanderings of a retail trader, Jean-Simon, sketch the contours of a microcosmic informal economy in Congolese society.  The financial urgency of everyday life is permeated by the political situation in Congo: a larger, more abstract urgency, which the diaspora experiences from a distance. The film finds itself somewhere in between these two imperatives, between here and somewhere else, the past and the present, small money and big money.
tagline: A film about Congo, made in Brussels.
title: A Country More Beautiful Than Before
